questions.questionText: What is the runway slope limit?
What is the maximum take-off weight for the A320?
What is the maximum landing weight for the A320?
What is the maximum altitude for take-off and landing?
What is the maximum fuel temperature?
What is the maximum cabin altitude differential pressure?
Concerning the APU what is the maximum APU EGT during start above 25000 ft?
What is the maximum wind for passenger door operation?
Maximum wind conditions for CAT II / III Automatic , landing and rollout:
questions.answerA: Headwind: 30 knots • Tailwind: 10 knots • Crosswind: 20 knots
questions.answerB: Headwind: 25 knots • Tailwind: 10 knots • Crosswind: 20 knots
questions.answerC: Headwind: 35 knots • Tailwind: 10 knots • Crosswind: 20 knots
questions.answerD: Headwind: 30 knots • Tailwind: 10 knots • Crosswind: 25 knots

questions.questionText: What is the maximum speed that the wipers can be operated?
What is the Minimum Altitude for autopilot engagement during takeoff and manual go-around?
questions.answerA: Take off with SRS mode: 100ft AGL and at least 5 seconds after liftoff
questions.answerB: Take off with SRS mode: 120ft AGL and at least 5 seconds after liftoff
questions.answerC: Take off with SRS mode: 100ft AGL and at least 15 seconds after liftoff
questions.answerD: Take off with SRS mode: 50ft AGL and at least 5 seconds after liftoff

questions.questionText: What is the maximum altitude for concerning the APU air condition & pressurization in dual pack operation?
What are the Maneuver Limit Load Factors with slats and flaps extended?
questions.answerA: 0.0 to +2.0 G's for slats and flaps extended
questions.answerB: 1.0 to +2.0 G's for slats and flaps extended
questions.answerC: 0.0 to +1.5 G's for slats and flaps extended
questions.answerD: 0.5 to +2.0 G's for slats and flaps extended

questions.questionText: What is the Maximum Operating speed Vmo/Mmo?
What is the maximum Landing Gear Tire Speed?
questions.answerA: The landing gear tires are limited to a ground speed of 195 knots
questions.answerB: The landing gear tires are limited to a ground speed of 205 knots
questions.answerC: The landing gear tires are limited to a ground speed of 215 knots
questions.answerD: The landing gear tires are limited to a ground speed of 185 knots

questions.questionText: The maximum and minimum glideslope angles for autoland are:
What is the operating restriction for HF Radio Operation?
questions.answerA: Do not operate in congested areas
questions.answerB: Do not operate HF radios during refueling operations
questions.answerC: Do not operate when VHF communication is available
questions.answerD: Do not operate the HF in the hangar

questions.questionText: What is the maximum crosswind for NEO engine start?
When is it allowed to use reverse?
questions.answerA: It is recommended to use reverse below 70kts

questions.questionText: What is the maximum altitude to extend slats/flaps?
questions.answerA: Do not extend the flaps/slats above FL100
questions.answerB: Do not extend the flaps/slats above FL150
questions.answerC: Do not extend the flaps/slats above FL200
questions.answerD: Do not extend the flaps/slats above FL250

questions.questionText: What are the Weather Radar restrictions for use?
questions.answerA: Do not operate the weather radar in a hangar or within 50 feet of any personnel or fuel spill
questions.answerB: Do not operate the weather radar in a hangar or within 50 feet of any personnel or fuel spill or people
questions.answerD: Do not operate the weather radar in a hangar or within 60 feet of any personnel or fuel spill

questions.questionText: What is the normal operating hydraulic pressure?
questions.answerA: The normal hydraulic operating pressure is 2,000 PSI plus or minus 200 PSI
questions.answerB: answerB”: “The normal hydraulic operating pressure is 2,500 PSI plus or minus 200 PSI
questions.answerC: The normal hydraulic operating pressure is 3,000 PSI plus or minus 100 PSI
questions.answerD: The normal hydraulic operating pressure is 3,000 PSI plus or minus 200 PSI
